issues.location: top of the form (logo and main title)
issues.description: Duplicate branding with the logo ("TRACK • COMPETE • WIN") and main title "FLIPPERHUB" creates visual clutter
issues.recommendation: Remove the main title "FLIPPERHUB" below the logo, keeping only the logo

issues.description: "USERNAME OR EMAIL" and "PASSWORD" labels are in uppercase but not bolded, reducing visual hierarchy
issues.recommendation: Bold the labels to distinguish them from input placeholders

issues.description: The "Remember me" checkbox is too small for easy interaction
issues.recommendation: Increase the checkbox size to 16x16px or larger

issues.description: Insufficient vertical spacing between the password field and the checkbox/link group
issues.recommendation: Add 8px vertical spacing between the password field and the checkbox/link

issues.description: The "Forgot password?" link lacks visual distinction (e.g., underline), making it less noticeable
issues.recommendation: Style the link with an underline and hover effect

issues.description: The login button has minimal padding, reducing tap target size
issues.recommendation: Increase button padding to 12px vertically and 24px horizontally

issues.description: The subtitle "Tournament Management System" is too small and not aligned with the main title
issues.recommendation: Increase subtitle font size to 14px and align it with the main title

issues.description: Form elements are not centered within the card, creating asymmetrical alignment
issues.recommendation: Center-align all form elements within the card

issues.description: The footer text "Secure Tournament Management" is too small and not prominent
issues.recommendation: Increase footer text size to 12px and add a subtle underline

issues.description: The checkbox is too small, making it difficult to interact with for users with motor impairments
issues.recommendation: Increase checkbox size to 16x16px or larger

Home::desktop.summary: Redundant branding and inconsistent typography reduce visual hierarchy, while insufficient spacing and small interactive elements hinder usability.
